snippet: Los Jaguares, the only team in Super Rugby based in the Western Hemisphere, will have flown more than 35,000 miles before their second bye in Week 11.
abstract: Argentine rugby team Los Jaguares is only Super Ruby team in Western Hemisphere and has had to travel over 35,000 miles for matches in first 11 weeks of its first season in league; coach Raul Perez has to rotate players in order to reduce fatigue.
lead_paragraph: Los Jaguares, the only team in Super Rugby based in the Western Hemisphere, will have flown more than 35,000 miles before their second bye in Week 11.

headline.main: Argentine Team’s Frequent-Flier Miles Can’t Buy It Wins
headline.print_headline: Their Frequent-Flier Miles Can’t Buy Them Wins
